hedline.hl1: Sip With a Straw And an Agenda

abstract.p: Robert F Kennedy Jr introduces Keeper Springs, bottled mountain spring water; pledges profits to local water preservation groups around New York State (S)

block.p: Drink my clean water, and help protect yours: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., long an environmentalist, recently introduced Keeper Springs mountain spring water. Influenced by Paul Newman's charitable example, Mr. Kennedy pledges the profits to local water conservation groups. ''When people think of the environment, they think of global issues like the ozone layer or the destruction of the rain forest,'' he said. ''They don't think about their own backyard.''
The water is already available in the New York area and will be sold nationally next year. The suggested price is 89 cents for a half-liter and $1.39 for 1.5 liters.

Drink my clean water, and help protect yours: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., long an environmentalist, recently introduced Keeper Springs mountain spring water. Influenced by Paul Newman's charitable example, Mr. Kennedy pledges the profits to local water conservation groups. ''When people think of the environment, they think of global issues like the ozone layer or the destruction of the rain forest,'' he said. ''They don't think about their own backyard.''
The water is already available in the New York area and will be sold nationally next year. The suggested price is 89 cents for a half-liter and $1.39 for 1.5 liters.

The proceeds will be used to protect water supplies where the water is bought. Revenues from the Northeastern debut will go to organizations like Riverkeeper, a conservation group in Garrison-on-Hudson, N.Y., where Mr. Kennedy is a lawyer; the Long Island Sound Keeper, and the New York Watershed.
Mr. Kennedy guarantees that Keeper Springs will be bottled in Saratoga Springs, N.Y., in such a way that fish, especially spawning fish, are not disturbed.
